intro: Mulgedium tataricum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered tatarian mulgedium, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to Central Asia and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its foliage has a mild, aromatic scent, and it is valued for its unique appearance in horticultural settings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in many regions.
